name: Aditya
Pathak
Home.about:
Hi! I'm Aditya Pathak, I'm from Bihar and currently I'm pursuing my Bachelor of Technology from Chandigarh Group of College, Landran. Talking about my skills I'm proficient in Python programming language and Full-Stack Web development. Other than these I have made several project for which I have filed patents and wrote Research papers.
In terms of Real world projects and experience I have built a website for our College Chandigarh Group of College to organize a confrence for authors of Research Papers. The papers were published in Springer and the conference was sponsored by All India Council of Technical Education (AICTE).
Moreover, I have won a few inter-college coding contests and ideathons. Other than these I have presesnted my project to the head of Niti Aayog on 1st December 2021 and to the Speaker of Punjab Vidhan Sabha on the ocassion of Parivartan in 2022

Object Detection System for Visually imp: The project is using a deep learning algorithm YOLO v5 which is about 2.5 times faster than other CNN algorithms
As output, it tells the user the name of object present in front of the user/camera
It can be used as motion sensor camera of surveillance camera
Monument Identification and detailing de: The project is using a deep learning algorithm YOLO v5 which is about 2.5 times faster than other CNN algorithms
As output, it tells the user the ndetails of the Monument such as the place where it is situated, current temparature of the place, distance of the monument from user's current location etc.
Other than these, it can be used as an assistant by commomn people or by local guides to promote tourism
Health & Habit Tracker: The project receives some useful insights such as activity minutes, heart rate from Google Fit API, location info from IP address and and store these data in a database.
These data are later used to extract information like Blood-Pressure, Sugar Level and Pulse rate of the user in real time

Automated Unmanned Aerial Vehicle Detect.desc: This method uses a deep learning model to detect drones, recognizing them outside human vision or difficult to identify. It uses a convolutional neural network (CNN) to create a bounding box around the drone, identifying its type. The method can detect both static and mobile drones, even at high speeds. The neural network classifies images into multiple frames, identifying the drone's area and labeling. With 100% accuracy over 178 epochs, it can be used for commercial and defense purposes. The method has been trained to avoid box and object loss.

Adjustable Eating Assistive System For T.inventors: Aditya Pathak, Jay Jain, Tanisha Yadav, Abhishek, Lakshya Pratap Singh, Parneet Kaur
Adjustable Eating Assistive System For T.desc: This method uses a deep learning model to detect drones, recognizing them outside human vision or difficult to identify. It uses a convolutional neural network (CNN) to create a bounding box around the drone, identifying its type. The method can detect both static and mobile drones, even at high speeds. The neural network classifies images into multiple frames, identifying the drone's area and labeling. With 100% accuracy over 178 epochs, it can be used for commercial and defense purposes. The method has been trained to avoid box and object loss.

SONAR-Based Health Monitoring & Support.desc: The Sonar-Based Health Monitoring And Support Device was developed to tackle health issues during the pandemic. It aids visually impaired individuals by providing guidance on obstacles. The device uses low-frequency SONAR to detect disturbances and identify objects. It can monitor blood pressure, hemoglobin levels, and blood sugar levels, making it suitable for wearable devices. It also features accident alerts and location tracking for emergency situations.

Data Encryption using Morse Code.publisher: CGC International Journal of Contemporary Technology and Research
Data Encryption using Morse Code.author: Aditya Pathak, Anmol Chahal, Sagar
Data Encryption using Morse Code.desc: Cryptography is a method of hiding or protecting data from unauthorized access. With the rise of internet usage, data security is a major concern due to cyber-attacks and over-reliance on the internet. Cryptographic algorithms are used to ensure data is accessible only to the intended user. Morse code, a method of encryption, can be used to encrypt data but may pose a threat to user data. Python's Cryptography module, which uses symmetric encryption, is used to encrypt both the algorithm and data files. This paper demonstrates how Morse code, time, and Python's Cryptography module can be combined to provide maximum data safety. safety.

Privacy Enhancement in Internet of Thing.author: Aditya Pathak, Parveen Singla, Hitendra Garg, Gagandeep, Simar Preet Singh
Privacy Enhancement in Internet of Thing.desc: In today's world, data leakage on computer systems, Internet of Things (IoT) devices, or mobile devices carries a significant threat due to weaker encryption or communication techniques, resulting in the loss of data items. Identifying the leakage of sensitive data during data transmission requires an appropriate technique. In the IoT environment, default permissions granted to devices often lead to data leakage. This proposed method offers data leakage security based on data sensitivity. However, classifying sensitive data is challenging due to its large volume and data transformation. The proposed technique utilizes the minimum redundancy and maximum relevancy (mRMR) technique for feature selection. It accurately detects confidential data better than existing state-of-the-art methods and can identify rephrased confidential contents using filter-based features for sequential data leak deterrence. Specifically, data leakage measurement can be achieved using DBSCAN (Density-based Spatial Clustering of Applications with Noise) to average F-statistical values measured over individual time steps and to ensure continuity between leakage data points.
